resources.string: Two Montana State counseling students receive prestigious fellowship
Montana State wins $1 million grant to explore quantum economy potential

Congratulations to the graduates of Montana State University\'s spring Class of 2023 who were awarded degrees during its 138th commencement ceremonies on Friday, May 12, at the Brick Breeden Fieldhouse.

Two Montana State University students who plan to use their education to provide mental health counseling services to underserved populations have been awarded a coveted fellowship to help them meet their goals.

As part of a new project funded with $1 million from the National Science Foundation, Montana State University will explore ways to leverage its expertise in photonics to grow a regional economy for precision agriculture and other technologies involving autonomous systems.
